meanings.definition: The dried bark of certain trees, used as a source of saponin.
meanings.sent1: The soapbark is collected and processed to extract saponin.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use soapbark to make natural cleaning products.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use soapbark as a makeshift surfboard.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as cleansing as soapbark, washing away all doubts.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of soapbark filled the room, reminiscent of fresh laundry.

meanings.definition: A tree of the genus Quillaja, native to South America.
meanings.sent1: The soapbark tree provides shade and shelter to many animals.
meanings.sent2: In South America, the soapbark is a symbol of resilience.
meanings.sent3: The soapbark tree whispered secrets to the wind, swaying gently.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter rang out like the rustling leaves of a soapbark tree.
meanings.sent5: Under the soapbark's branches, children played and laughed joyfully.
